block.p: Rory Beth O'Dea, a daughter of Eileen and James J. O'Dea of Seaford, N.Y., was married yesterday to John Belfield Murphy, a son of Mary and Robert G. Murphy of Convent Station, N.J. Msgr. Peter V. Kain performed the ceremony at St. Dominic's Chapel in Oyster Bay, N.Y.
The bride and bridegroom are advertising account executives in New York, she for Comedy Central, the cable television network, and he for the CBS network.

Rory Beth O'Dea, a daughter of Eileen and James J. O'Dea of Seaford, N.Y., was married yesterday to John Belfield Murphy, a son of Mary and Robert G. Murphy of Convent Station, N.J. Msgr. Peter V. Kain performed the ceremony at St. Dominic's Chapel in Oyster Bay, N.Y.
The bride and bridegroom are advertising account executives in New York, she for Comedy Central, the cable television network, and he for the CBS network.
Mrs. Murphy, 30, graduated from Fairfield University. Her father, a retired detective in the New York Police Department, was on the pickpocket and confidence squad.
Mr. Murphy, 28, graduated from Brown. His father retired as the chief credit officer for Merrill Lynch & Company, the New York securities brokerage firm.
